title: Why New Zealand have moved heaven, earth and Beauden Barrett to get Richie Mo'unga in the side
text:
Speaking after New Zealand suffered an apparently seismic 16-9 defeat to Ireland last November, Steve Hansen issued a gentle reminder that there was a lot of water to go under the bridge before the World Cup. “A lot can happen,” Hansen said. “Injuries, brainwaves, sacked coaches, new coaches...”

One injury and one brainwave later, New Zealand prepare to face Ireland in the World Cup quarter-finals on Saturday at the Tokyo Stadium with a markedly different back line from 11 months ago. If “Pooper” – Australia’s combination of openside flankers David Pocock and Michael Hooper – was the defining selection of the 2015 World Cup so Hansen’s pairing of Richie Mo’unga and Beauden Barrett at fly-half...
